main event: On October 22, 1962, a white starlike object was observed moving southeast for 45 seconds before disappearing behind clouds.
interesting points: The object was detected using ground-radar and initially appeared to be accelerating,The sighting occurred at 30 degrees elevation where the object was lost from sight,It was described as a single sound-brite object of the size of a second magnitude star,No photographs captured despite the report indicating otherwise,Multiple military sources corroborated the sighting with consistent descriptions of the object's trajectory.
witness description: military personnel involved in radar observation and communications
